medical_history.chief_complaint: Mass in the middle lobe of the right lung.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual health until 1 month prior to admission when she developed pain in the right shoulder and discomfort in the left lower abdomen. The shoulder pain worsened with inspiration and was associated with nonproductive cough, intermittent fevers (up to 38.1Â°C), sinus pain, nasal discharge, and difficulty breathing. Eleven days before admission, a new cardiac murmur was detected and imaging revealed a mass in the right middle lobe and a right pleural effusion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hydrocephalus at 17 years of age, temporal-lobe epilepsy due to a right mesial temporal cavernous malformation (successfully resected), and a stable second cavernous malformation in the cerebellum.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of rheumatoid arthritis, coronary artery disease, hypertension, and asthma.
medical_history.social_history: Born in Europe; moved to the United States 8 years ago. Visited Switzerland, California, and Michigan in the past year; visited Cuba 10 years ago. Married, worked in a research field with exposure to yeast and mice 2 years ago. Non-smoker, does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs.
